value.title: Ever wanted a NOTIFICATION in your Power BI Reports?
value.excerpt: Maybe you want your Power BI report users to get be notified of some changes that occurred. And, you want that displayed within the report. value.title: Excel and OneDrive with Power BI For Collaboration
value.excerpt: In this 2 minute Tuesday, Patrick looks at how to use Excel and OneDrive with Power BI For Collaboration. Using this approach, you can easily keep Power BI updated when team members update an Excel spreadsheet hosted on OneDrive. This is a great alternative to using Google Sheets which can be painful

value.title: Parameters and Templates with Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows a way you can use parameters and templates, with Power BI Desktop, to provide prompts for your connection's server and database properties.   This is great for when you are creating a report, and need to share it with a customer that may have a different name for the server

value.title: Create Customized Age Bins or Groups in Power BI
value.excerpt: Power BI has the built-in feature of creating binning for a numeric field such as age. However, the default binning will create bins of equal size. If you want to create bins of different sizes, then you need to create that as a custom column. Fortunately, Power Query has transformations that can help.

value.title: Get Data from Multiple Excel Files with Different Sheet Names into Power BI

value.title: Multi select slicer in Power BI
value.excerpt: This is a very short, simple video about how to have a multi-select slicer in Power BI. value.excerpt: Power BI reports are highly interactive, If you select a column in a column chart other charts will be highlighted.
